noun.description: A formal declaration that someone is guilty of a criminal offense, made by the verdict of a jury or the decision of a judge in a court of law.
examples: she had a previous conviction for a similar offense

noun.description: A firmly held belief or opinion.
examples: she takes pride in stating her political convictions
his conviction that the death was no accident

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin convictio(n-), from the verb convincere (see convince).
